Spanish: El sol caliente ayuda a secar la ropa mojada.
English: The hot sun helps to dry the wet clothes.

Spanish: No debes pisar el césped recién cortado.
English: You should not step on the freshly cut grass.

Spanish: Voy a enviar un regalo de cumpleaños a mi amigo.
English: I am going to send a birthday gift to my friend.

Spanish: Los ladrones serán castigados por sus crímenes.
English: The thieves will be punished for their crimes.

Spanish: El café se acabó, necesitamos comprar más.
English: The coffee ran out, we need to buy more.

Spanish: Empezar un nuevo proyecto puede ser emocionante.
English: Starting a new project can be exciting.

Spanish: La niña pequeña comenzó a llorar cuando se lastimó.
English: The little girl started crying when she got hurt.

Spanish: Voy a deshacer el nudo en esta cuerda.
English: I am going to untie the knot in this rope.

Spanish: Por favor, aprieta el botón para encender la luz.
English: Please press the button to turn on the light.

Spanish: Siempre sonríe cuando ve a su abuela.
English: She always smiles when she sees her grandmother.

Spanish: Te acompañaré al aeropuerto para despedirte.
English: I will accompany you to the airport to say goodbye.

Spanish: Me gusta desayunarme con un buen café por las mañanas.
English: I like to have breakfast with a good coffee in the mornings.

Spanish: El avión va a aterrizar en diez minutos.
English: The plane is going to land in ten minutes.

Spanish: El fotógrafo logró capturar la belleza del paisaje.
English: The photographer managed to capture the beauty of the landscape.

Spanish: No gastes todo tu dinero en cosas innecesarias.
English: Don't spend all your money on unnecessary things.

Spanish: Voy a buscar las llaves antes de salir de casa.
English: I am going to look for the keys before leaving the house.

Spanish: Me gusta despertarme temprano para disfrutar del amanecer.
English: I like to wake up early to enjoy the sunrise.

Spanish: El perro comenzó a temblar durante la tormenta.
English: The dog started trembling during the storm.

Spanish: Voy a pulir esta mesa de madera para que brille.
English: I am going to polish this wooden table to make it shine.

Spanish: Las abejas empiezan a zumbar cuando se acerca la colmena.
English: The bees start buzzing when the hive is approached.

Spanish: Sé que la respuesta está en algún lugar.
English: I know the answer is somewhere.

Spanish: Votar es un derecho fundamental en una democracia.
English: Voting is a fundamental right in a democracy.

Spanish: La teoría se basa en principios científicos.
English: The theory is based on scientific principles.

Spanish: Me asusté cuando vi la película de terror.
English: I got scared when I watched the horror movie.

Spanish: Nos reímos mucho durante la fiesta.
English: We laughed a lot during the party.

Spanish: Por favor, explícame cómo funciona este aparato.
English: Please explain to me how this device works.

Spanish: Es importante saber cómo defenderse en situaciones peligrosas.
English: It's important to know how to defend oneself in dangerous situations.

Spanish: El activista luchó por liberar a los prisioneros políticos.
English: The activist fought to free the political prisoners.

Spanish: Suelta el globo para que pueda volar.
English: Let go of the balloon so it can fly.

Spanish: Me encanta comer sushi los viernes.
English: I love eating sushi on Fridays.

Spanish: Ella describió el paisaje con gran detalle.
English: She described the landscape in great detail.

Spanish: Espero alcanzar mis metas profesionales este año.
English: I hope to achieve my professional goals this year.

Spanish: Sacar conclusiones apresuradas puede ser perjudicial.
English: Jumping to conclusions can be harmful.

Spanish: Aprender a manejar un automóvil es una habilidad útil.
English: Learning to drive a car is a useful skill.

Spanish: Finalmente, logré terminar el proyecto a tiempo.
English: Finally, I managed to finish the project on time.

Spanish: Voy a planchar mi camisa para la reunión.
English: I'm going to iron my shirt for the meeting.

Spanish: Después de la cena, dimos una vuelta por el parque.
English: After dinner, we took a walk in the park.

Spanish: A veces es necesario arriesgar para alcanzar el éxito.
English: Sometimes it's necessary to take risks to achieve success.

Spanish: Logré hallar las llaves que había perdido.
English: I managed to find the keys I had lost.

Spanish: Rezo todas las noches antes de dormir.
English: I pray every night before sleeping.

Spanish: Cuida a tu hermanito mientras yo cocino la cena.
English: Take care of your little brother while I cook dinner.

Spanish: Prefiero escoger la opción más saludable en el menú.
English: I prefer to choose the healthiest option on the menu.

Spanish: En invierno, suele nevar mucho en esta región.
English: In winter, it often snows a lot in this region.

Spanish: Después de casarse, decidieron mudarse a una casa más grande.
English: After getting married, they decided to move to a bigger house.

Spanish: No quiero perder la oportunidad de viajar por el mundo.
English: I don't want to miss the opportunity to travel the world.

Spanish: El cielo comenzó a tronar justo antes de la tormenta.
English: The sky started to thunder just before the storm.

Spanish: Debes admitir tus errores y aprender de ellos.
English: You should admit your mistakes and learn from them.

Spanish: No puedes parquear en esa zona, es solo para residentes.
English: You can't park in that area, it's for residents only.

Spanish: Es importante obedecer las reglas de tráfico para evitar accidentes.
English: It's important to obey the traffic rules to avoid accidents.

Spanish: Voy a relatar la historia tal como la recuerdo.
English: I am going to narrate the story just as I remember it.

Spanish: Por favor, no empujes a la gente en la fila.
English: Please don't push people in line.

Spanish: Decidí dejar de fumar para mejorar mi salud.
English: I decided to quit smoking to improve my health.

Spanish: No exageres, solo fue una pequeña discusión.
English: Don't exaggerate, it was just a small argument.

Spanish: El periodista va a reportar en vivo desde el lugar del accidente.
English: The journalist is going to report live from the scene of the accident.

Spanish: El mecánico va a cobrar por reparar el auto.
English: The mechanic is going to charge for repairing the car.

Spanish: Vamos a salir a caminar por el parque esta tarde.
English: We are going to go for a walk in the park this afternoon.

Spanish: Lamentablemente, su abuelo acaba de morir.
English: Unfortunately, his grandfather just passed away.

Spanish: Juro que nunca más volveré a mentirte.
English: I swear I will never lie to you again.

Spanish: La banda va a ensayar la nueva canción antes del concierto.
English: The band is going to rehearse the new song before the concert.

Spanish: Quisiera mencionar agradecimientos a todos los que nos apoyaron.
English: I would like to mention thanks to everyone who supported us.

Spanish: El perro intentó morder la pelota, pero se le escapó.
English: The dog tried to bite the ball, but it slipped away.

Spanish: Los guardias deben vigilar la entrada las 24 horas del día.
English: The guards must watch the entrance 24 hours a day.

Spanish: Ella observó las estrellas durante horas en la noche.
English: She observed the stars for hours at night.

Spanish: Después de mojarse en la lluvia, él empezó a enfermarse.
English: After getting wet in the rain, he started to get sick.

Spanish: Te propongo que vayamos juntos al concierto este fin de semana.
English: I propose that we go together to the concert this weekend.

Spanish: El bailarín hizo girar a su pareja en el escenario.
English: The dancer made his partner spin on stage.

Spanish: No creo que quepa todo en esa pequeña caja.
English: I don't think everything will fit in that small box.

Spanish: Ella movió la mesa para limpiar debajo.
English: She moved the table to clean underneath.

Spanish: Fíjate bien en los detalles antes de tomar una decisión.
English: Pay close attention to the details before making a decision.

Spanish: Voy a introducirte a mi amigo en la fiesta de esta noche.
English: I'm going to introduce you to my friend at tonight's party.

Spanish: El concierto continuará a pesar de la lluvia.
English: The concert will continue despite the rain.

Spanish: Imploro que me perdones por lo que dije, no era mi intención ofenderte.
English: I beg for your forgiveness for what I said, it wasn't my intention to offend you.

Spanish: No te preocupes, no te perderás en la ciudad con este mapa.
English: Don't worry, you won't get lost in the city with this map.

Spanish: No te equivoques, esta es la dirección correcta.
English: Don't make a mistake, this is the right address.

Spanish: Me gusta madrugar para ver el amanecer en la playa.
English: I like to get up early to watch the sunrise at the beach.

Spanish: El entrenador le gritó al equipo para motivarlos a dar lo mejor.
English: The coach shouted at the team to motivate them to do their best.

Spanish: Vamos a explorar el bosque y ver qué podemos encontrar.
English: Let's explore the forest and see what we can find.

Spanish: El bombero logró salvar al gato del incendio.
English: The firefighter managed to save the cat from the fire.

Spanish: Ayúdame a cargar estas cajas al camión, por favor.
English: Help me load these boxes onto the truck, please.

Spanish: Ten cuidado al bajar las escaleras, están resbaladizas.
English: Be careful when going down the stairs, they are slippery.

Spanish: La fiesta va a ocurrir en mi casa el sábado.
English: The party is going to take place at my house on Saturday.

Spanish: Después de dejar de fumar, mi amigo empezó a engordarse.
English: After quitting smoking, my friend started to gain weight.

Spanish: No debes fingir ser alguien que no eres.
English: You should not pretend to be someone you are not.

Spanish: El ladrón decidió huir cuando escuchó la sirena de la policía.
English: The thief decided to flee when he heard the police siren.

Spanish: Vamos a cenar en ese restaurante italiano esta noche.
English: We are going to have dinner at that Italian restaurant tonight.

Spanish: Ella me miró con una sonrisa en su rostro.
English: She looked at me with a smile on her face.

Spanish: Todos debemos contribuir a proteger el medio ambiente.
English: We all must contribute to protecting the environment.

Spanish: Mi abuela solía coser sus propias prendas de vestir.
English: My grandmother used to sew her own clothes.

Spanish: Después de caminar mucho, decidimos sentarnos en el parque.
English: After walking a lot, we decided to sit in the park.

Spanish: Mi mejor amigo se llama Juan.
English: My best friend's name is Juan.

Spanish: Por favor, no olvides coger el correo antes de salir.
English: Please do not forget to pick up the mail before leaving.

Spanish: Es importante masticar bien los alimentos antes de tragar.
English: It is important to chew food well before swallowing.

Spanish: Mi hermano mayor aprendió a conducir cuando tenía dieciocho años.
English: My older brother learned to drive when he was eighteen.

Spanish: A pesar de los obstáculos, no debes desistir de tus sueños.
English: Despite the obstacles, you should not give up on your dreams.

Spanish: Los ciudadanos decidieron luchar por sus derechos.
English: The citizens decided to fight for their rights.

Spanish: Aprendí a patinar sobre hielo cuando era niño.
English: I learned to ice skate when I was a child.

Spanish: Por favor, pon el libro en la mesa.
English: Please put the book on the table.

Spanish: Voy a tapar la olla para que la comida se cocine más rápido.
English: I am going to cover the pot so the food cooks faster.

Spanish: No puedo suponer lo que piensas si no me lo dices.
English: I cannot assume what you think if you do not tell me.

Spanish: Mi hermana pequeña le encanta cantar en el coro de la escuela.
English: My little sister loves to sing in the school choir.
